citeinfo.title: STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN: Structural Features of Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, Line Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN.SHP was produced by IGS personnel on July 18, 2002, using numerous previously published paper source maps that contained mapped structural features in Indiana. It was subsequently updated on December 10, 2013, with additional structural features that have been recently mapped. Further, the attribute table was updated to include the name of the original paper source map for each structural feature, and a directional indicator of fault movement was added to aid in cartographic display.

descript.abstract: STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN.SHP is a line shapefile that shows the location of known structural features in Indiana. Attributes include the name of the feature (as listed on the paper source maps), a citation to which paper source source map contained the feature, as well as an indicatior of structural movement of each feature. The paper source maps used to construct these data have scales that range from 1:12,000 to 1:500,000 (only one fault trace) with the majority being taken from sources with a scale of 1:63,360 or larger.
descript.purpose: STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN.SHP was created to show the most accurate information available on locations of structural features in Indiana, utilizable in a GIS system.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS 10.2 shapefile format, approximately 68 Kb

attracc.attraccr: Locations and names of structural features were plotted and checked by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey for accuracy.

dataqual.logic: Lines were clipped by STATLINE.SHP, a line shapefile of the state of Indiana taken from 1:100,000-scale information, which was created for the Gas Research Institute/Illinois Basin Consortium publication GRI-00/0068.

horizpa.horizpar: Whenever possible, digitized maps were calibrated to the nearest logical planimetric intersections.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy of the published and nonpublished paper source maps is unknown. The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of this dataset. No quantitative tests were performed.

citeinfo.origin: Robin F. Rupp, William J. Steen, and Anthony H. Fleming
citeinfo.title: Map of Allen County, Indiana Showing the Topography and Geology of the Bedrock Surface
citeinfo.othercit: Indiana Geological Survey Special Report 57, Plate 2

srcinfo.srccontr: Two unnamed faults in Allen County (added to STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN.SHP in October, 2013).

procstep.procdesc: A paper copy of each source map were placed on a digitizing board and calibrated to UTM coordinates in AutoDesk AutoCAD software. After all traces were digitized, two line coverages were created using ESRI ArcCAD software. Structural features were saved as an ESRI coverage named "INDSTRUC" and structural directional features were saved as "INSTRDIR". These coverages were then loaded into ESRI ArcView 3.2 and attributed with the accepted names of the structural features. The digitization of the structural features named "Sharpsville Fault" and "Fortville Fault" were performed by an IGS geologist using Surfer software and exported in DXF format. This DXF file was imported into ESRI ArcView and converted to a temporary coverage. Both datasets of structural features were then joined in ESRI ArcView using the GeoProcessing Wizard, and was then saved as "INSTRUC".

INDSTRUC and INSTRDIR were joined to a single coverage named "STRUCT" using ESRI ArcInfo. STRUCT was then reprojected to UTM Zone 16, NAD83 coordinate system, and then clipped to the boundary of Indiana, using the clip coverage named INCLP83. INCLP83 was compiled at at a scale of 1:24,000. Because STRUCT and INCLP83 boundaries did not coincide perfectly with one another, some lines along the state boundary were either slightly truncated or slightly extended to the new boundary. In every case, the modifications were minor. The resulting coverage was then saved as an ESRI line shapefile named "STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN.SHP" to follow the file naming conventions of the IGS.

The paper source map named "Map of Allen County, Indiana Showing the Topography and Geology of the Bedrock Surface" (Indiana Geological Survey Special Report 57, Plate 2) was scanned and saved as a TIFF file named "IGS_SR57.TIF." IGS_SR57.TIF was loaded into an ESRI ArcMap document and the "Georeferencing" tool used to georeference it to UTM Zone 16, NAD83 coordinate system. IGS personnel digitized two unnamed structural faults using IGS_SR57.TIF as a basemap, and the two features were then saved as a shapefile named "AC_FAULT_LINES.SHP."

The two unnamed structural fault line features from AC_FAULT_LINES.SHP were added to STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN.SHP using an ESRI ArcMap edit session. Additional attribute fields were then added to STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN.SHP. The field named "Source" was added to provide a citation linking the source map that was used to digitize each structural feature. The field named "Symbol" was added to contain a directional indicator of the geologic movement associated with each structural feature. The field named "Structure_" was added to distinguish between faults and anticlines. All faults and anticlines went through a QA/QC where the source maps were re-scanned, geo-referenced with RMS Error less than 75 meters, and all features were adjusted or re-digitized to match the source maps and provide the highest quality dataset.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Value to delineate the direction of movement for the structural feature
Structural feature type (either Anticline or Fault)
Source map from which the structural feature was obtained

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the Indiana Geological Survey be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: [STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN: Structural Features of Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, Line Shapefile), 2013)]
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove Avenue, Bloomington, Indiana 47405-2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
